iti28:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti28:2.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ viharati savighātaṃ saupāyāsaṃ sapariḷāhaṃ;
iti28:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has two qualities they live unhappily in this very life—with distress, anguish, and fever—

iti28:2.2.pli: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
iti28:2.2.eng: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.

iti28:2.4.pli: Indriyesu aguttadvāratāya ca, bhojane amattaññutāya ca.
iti28:2.4.eng: Not guarding the sense doors and eating too much.

iti28:2.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ viharati savighātaṃ saupāyāsaṃ sapariḷāhaṃ;
iti28:2.5.eng: When a mendicant possesses these two qualities they live unhappily in this very life—with distress, anguish, and fever—

iti28:2.6.pli: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
iti28:2.6.eng: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.”

iti28:5.4.eng: such a person lives in suffering.”

iti28:6.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti28:6.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti29:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti29:2.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṃ viharati avighātaṃ anupāyāsaṃ apariḷāhaṃ;
iti29:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has two qualities they live happily in this very life—without distress, anguish, and fever—

iti29:2.2.pli: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugati pāṭikaṅkhā.
iti29:2.2.eng: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.

iti29:2.4.pli: Indriyesu guttadvāratāya ca, bhojane mattaññutāya ca.
iti29:2.4.eng: Guarding the sense doors and moderation in eating.

iti29:2.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṃ viharati avighātaṃ anupāyāsaṃ apariḷāhaṃ;
iti29:2.5.eng: When a mendicant possesses these two qualities they live happily in this very life—without distress, anguish, and fever—

iti29:2.6.pli: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugati pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
iti29:2.6.eng: and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.”

iti29:5.4.eng: such a person lives in happiness.”

iti29:6.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti29:6.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti3:2.4.eng: Delusion is the one thing. Give it up,

iti3:3.2.eng: beings go to a bad place.

iti3:3.6.eng: they never return to this world.”

iti30:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti30:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti, akatakusalo, akatabhīruttāṇo, katapāpo, kataluddo, katakibbiso.
iti30:2.3.eng: It’s when someone hasn’t done good and skillful things that keep them safe, but has done bad things, violence and sin.

iti30:2.4.pli: So ‘akataṃ me kalyāṇan’tipi tappati, ‘kataṃ me pāpan’tipi tappati.
iti30:2.4.eng: Thinking, ‘I haven’t done good things’, they’re mortified. Thinking, ‘I have done bad things’, they’re mortified.

iti30:2.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā tapanīyā”ti.
iti30:2.5.eng: These are the two things that are mortifying.”

iti30:4.3.eng: when their body breaks up, that witless person

iti30:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti30:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti31:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti31:2.1.eng: “These two things, mendicants, are not mortifying.

iti31:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco katakalyāṇo hoti, katakusalo, katabhīruttāṇo, akatapāpo, akataluddo, akatakibbiso.
iti31:2.3.eng: It’s when someone has done good and skillful things that keep them safe, but has not done bad things, violence and sin.

iti31:2.4.pli: So ‘kataṃ me kalyāṇan’tipi na tappati, ‘akataṃ me pāpan’tipi na tappati.
iti31:2.4.eng: Thinking, ‘I have done good things’, they’re not mortified. Thinking, ‘I haven’t done bad things’, they’re not mortified.

iti31:2.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā atapanīyā”ti.
iti31:2.5.eng: These are the two things that are not mortifying.”

iti31:4.3.eng: when their body breaks up, that wise person

iti31:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti31:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti32:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti32:2.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato puggalo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
iti32:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, an individual with two qualities is cast down to hell.

iti32:2.3.pli: Pāpakena ca sīlena, pāpikāya ca diṭṭhiyā.

iti32:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato puggalo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye”ti.
iti32:2.4.eng: A individual with these two qualities is cast down to hell.”

iti32:3.5.eng: when their body breaks up, that witless person

iti32:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti32:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti33:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti33:2.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato puggalo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
iti33:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, an individual with two qualities is raised up to heaven.

iti33:2.3.pli: Bhaddakena ca sīlena, bhaddikāya ca diṭṭhiyā.

iti33:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato puggalo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
iti33:2.4.eng: A individual with these two qualities is raised up to heaven.”

iti33:3.5.eng: when their body breaks up, that wise person

iti33:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti33:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti34:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti34:2.1.pli: “Anātāpī, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anottāpī abhabbo sambodhāya, abhabbo nibbānāya, abhabbo anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāya.
iti34:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, without being keen and prudent a mendicant can’t achieve awakening, extinguishment, and the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

iti34:2.2.pli: Ātāpī ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ottāpī bhabbo sambodhāya, bhabbo nibbānāya, bhabbo anuttarassa yogakkhemassa adhigamāyā”ti.
iti34:2.2.eng: But if a mendicant is keen and prudent they can achieve awakening, extinguishment, and the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.”

iti34:4.1.eng: One who is mindful, alert, meditative,

iti34:4.3.eng: having cut the fetter of birth and old age,

iti34:4.4.eng: would experience supreme awakening <j>in this very life.”

iti34:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti34:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti35:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti35:2.1.pli: “Nayidaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhanatthaṃ, na janalapanatthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilokānisaṃsatthaṃ, na ‘iti maṃ jano jānātū’ti.
iti35:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, this spiritual life is not lived for the sake of fawning or flattering people, nor for the benefit of possessions, honor, or popularity, nor thinking, ‘So let people know about me!’

iti35:2.2.pli: Atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati saṃvaratthañceva pahānatthañcā”ti.
iti35:2.2.eng: This spiritual life is lived for the sake of restraint and giving up.”

iti35:3.3.eng: but for the sake of restraint and giving up,

iti35:3.4.eng: and because it culminates in extinguishment.

iti35:4.1.eng: This is the path followed by the great souls,

iti35:4.4.eng: as it was taught by the Buddha

iti35:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti35:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti36:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti36:2.1.pli: “Nayidaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati janakuhanatthaṃ, na janalapanatthaṃ, na lābhasakkārasilokānisaṃsatthaṃ, na ‘iti maṃ jano jānātū’ti.
iti36:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, this spiritual life is not lived for the sake of fawning or flattering people, nor for the benefit of possessions, honor, or popularity, nor thinking, ‘So let people know about me!’

iti36:2.2.pli: Atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati abhiññatthañceva pariññatthañcā”ti.
iti36:2.2.eng: This spiritual life is lived for the sake of direct knowledge and complete understanding.”

iti36:3.3.eng: but for the sake of insight and understanding,

iti36:3.4.eng: and because it culminates in extinguishment.

iti36:4.1.eng: This is the path followed by the great souls,

iti36:4.4.eng: as it was taught by the Buddha

iti36:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti36:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti37:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti37:2.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme sukhasomanassabahulo viharati, yoni cassa āraddhā hoti āsavānaṃ khayāya.
iti37:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has two qualities they’re full of joy and happiness in this very life, and they have laid the groundwork for ending the defilements.

iti37:2.3.pli: Saṃvejanīyesu ṭhānesu saṃvejanena, saṃviggassa ca yoniso padhānena.
iti37:2.3.eng: Being inspired at inspiring places, and making a suitable effort when inspired.

iti37:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme sukhasomanassabahulo viharati, yoni cassa āraddhā hoti āsavānaṃ khayāyā”ti.
iti37:2.4.eng: When a mendicant possesses these two qualities they’re full of joy and happiness in this very life, and they have laid the groundwork for ending the defilements.”

iti37:3.2.eng: an astute person should be inspired;

iti37:4.1.eng: A mendicant living like this, with keen energy,

iti37:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti37:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti38:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti38:2.1.pli: “Tathāgataṃ, bhikkhave, arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ dve vitakkā bahulaṃ samudācaranti—
iti38:2.1.eng: “Two thoughts, mendicants, often occur to the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha:

iti38:2.2.eng: the thought of sanctuary, and that of seclusion.

iti38:2.3.eng: The Realized One loves kindness and delights in it,

iti38:2.4.pli: Tamenaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ abyāpajjhārāmaṃ abyāpajjharataṃ eseva vitakko bahulaṃ samudācarati:
iti38:2.4.eng: so this thought often occurs to him:

iti38:2.5.pli: ‘imāyāhaṃ iriyāya na kañci byābādhemi tasaṃ vā thāvaraṃ vā’ti.
iti38:2.5.eng: ‘Through this behavior, I shall not hurt any creature firm or frail.’

iti38:3.1.eng: The Realized One loves seclusion and delights in it,

iti38:3.2.pli: Tamenaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgataṃ pavivekārāmaṃ pavivekarataṃ eseva vitakko bahulaṃ samudācarati:
iti38:3.2.eng: so this thought often occurs to him:

iti38:3.3.eng: ‘What is unskillful has been given up.’

iti38:4.1.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, tumhepi abyāpajjhārāmā viharatha abyāpajjharatā.
iti38:4.1.eng: So, mendicants, you too should love kindness and delight in it,

iti38:4.2.pli: Tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, tumhākaṃ abyāpajjhārāmānaṃ viharataṃ abyāpajjharatānaṃ eseva vitakko bahulaṃ samudācarissati:
iti38:4.2.eng: then this thought will often occur to you:

iti38:4.3.pli: ‘imāya mayaṃ iriyāya na kañci byābādhema tasaṃ vā thāvaraṃ vā’ti.
iti38:4.3.eng: ‘Through this behavior, I shall not hurt any creature firm or frail.’

iti38:5.1.eng: You too should love seclusion and delight in it,

iti38:5.2.pli: Tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, tumhākaṃ pavivekārāmānaṃ viharataṃ pavivekaratānaṃ eseva vitakko bahulaṃ samudācarissati:
iti38:5.2.eng: then this thought will often occur to you:

iti38:5.3.eng: ‘What is unskillful? What is not given up? What should I give up?’”

iti38:6.2.eng: the Realized One, the bearer of the unbearable:

iti38:6.3.eng: first mentioned was thought of sanctuary,

iti38:6.4.eng: then the second made clear was seclusion.

iti38:7.1.eng: Dispeller of darkness, the great seer has crossed over:

iti38:7.2.eng: the attained, the master, the undefiled.

iti38:7.3.eng: In the midst of it all, <j>he is freed in the ending of craving;

iti38:7.4.eng: that sage bears his final body.

iti38:7.5.eng: He has disposed of Māra, I declare, <j>and gone beyond old age.

iti38:8.1.eng: Standing high on a rocky mountain,

iti38:8.2.eng: you can see the people all around.

iti38:8.3.eng: In just the same way, the all-seer, so intelligent,

iti38:8.4.eng: having ascended the Temple of Truth,

iti38:8.5.eng: rid of sorrow, looks upon the people

iti38:8.6.eng: swamped with sorrow, overcome by rebirth and old age.”

iti38:9.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti38:9.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti39:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti39:2.1.pli: “Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa dve dhammadesanā pariyāyena bhavanti.
iti39:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha has two approaches to teaching Dhamma.

iti39:2.4.eng: this is the first approach to teaching Dhamma.

iti39:2.5.pli: ‘pāpaṃ pāpakato disvā tattha nibbindatha virajjatha vimuccathā’ti—
iti39:2.5.eng: ‘Having seen evil as evil, be disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from it’—

iti39:2.6.eng: this is the second approach to teaching Dhamma.

iti39:2.7.pli: Tathāgatassa, bhikkhave, arahato sammāsambuddhassa imā dve dhammadesanā pariyāyena bhavantī”ti.
iti39:2.7.eng: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha has these two approaches to teaching Dhamma.”

iti39:3.3.eng: used by the Realized One, the Buddha,

iti39:4.3.eng: Then, with a mind free of desire,

iti39:4.4.eng: you will make an end of suffering.”

iti39:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti39:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti4:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti4:2.4.eng: Anger is the one thing. Give it up,

iti4:3.2.eng: beings go to a bad place.

iti4:3.6.eng: they never return to this world.”

iti4:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti4:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
